database_description: Database for SLiMS (Senayan Library Management System), an open source library management system. Manages bibliographic data, item circulation, membership, and other library operations.

tables.name: backup_log
tables.description: Logs database backup activities.

tables.name: biblio
tables.description: Core table for bibliographic data of library collections.

relationships.relationship_description: A biblio record can have multiple attachments.
A biblio record can have multiple authors.
A biblio record can have multiple topics.
A biblio record can have multiple items (physical copies).
A biblio record can be reserved multiple times.
One-to-one relationship for custom fields.
A biblio record can have multiple comments.
A biblio record can have multiple log entries.

tables.name: biblio_attachment
tables.description: Links bibliographic records to file attachments.

relationships.relationship_description: Many attachments belong to one biblio record.
Many attachments can refer to one file.

tables.name: biblio_author
tables.description: связывает библиографические записи с авторами. Many-to-many relationship between biblio and mst_author tables.

relationships.relationship_description: Many biblio_author records belong to one biblio record.
Many biblio_author records belong to one author.
Many-to-many relationship with biblio through biblio_author.
Many-to-many relationship with mst_author through biblio_author.

tables.name: biblio_topic
tables.description: связывает библиографические записи с темами. Many-to-many relationship between biblio and mst_topic tables.

relationships.relationship_description: Many biblio_topic records belong to one biblio record.
Many biblio_topic records belong to one topic.
Many-to-many relationship with biblio through biblio_topic.
Many-to-many relationship with mst_topic through biblio_topic.

tables.name: content
tables.description: Stores static content pages for the library website.

tables.name: files
tables.description: Manages digital files uploaded to the system.

relationships.relationship_description: One file can be attached to multiple biblio records.
One file can have multiple read logs.

tables.name: fines
tables.description: Tracks fines incurred by library members.

relationships.relationship_description: Many fines can be associated with one member.

tables.name: group_access
tables.description: Defines access permissions for user groups to system modules.

relationships.relationship_description: Many group_access records can refer to one module.
Many group_access records can belong to one user group.

tables.name: holiday
tables.description: Stores holiday dates for library operation scheduling.

tables.name: item
tables.description: Represents physical copies of bibliographic records (items).

relationships.relationship_description: Many items belong to one biblio record.
One item can be involved in multiple loan transactions.
One item can be reserved multiple times.
One item can be part of multiple stock take processes.

tables.name: kardex
tables.description: Manages kardex records for serial publications.

relationships.relationship_description: Many kardex records belong to one serial publication.

tables.name: loan
tables.description: Tracks loan transactions of library items.

relationships.relationship_description: Many loan records can refer to one item.
Many loan records can be associated with one member.
Many loan records can follow one loan rule.
One-to-one relationship with loan_history (for historical data).

tables.name: loan_history
tables.description: Historical data of loan transactions, populated by triggers from the 'loan' table.

relationships.relationship_description: One-to-one relationship with loan (source of data).

tables.name: member
tables.description: Stores information about library members.

relationships.relationship_description: One member can have multiple fine records.
One member can have multiple loan transactions.
One member can make multiple reservations.
One-to-one relationship for custom member fields.
One member can write multiple comments.
One member can read multiple files.
One member can mark multiple biblios.
One member can have multiple visit logs.

tables.name: mst_author
tables.description: Master list of authors.

relationships.relationship_description: One author can be associated with multiple bibliographic records.

tables.name: mst_carrier_type
tables.description: Master list of RDA carrier types.

relationships.relationship_description: One carrier type can be used in multiple bibliographic records.

tables.name: mst_coll_type
tables.description: Master list of collection types.

relationships.relationship_description: One collection type can be used for multiple bibliographic records.
One collection type can be assigned to multiple items.

tables.name: mst_content_type
tables.description: Master list of RDA content types.

relationships.relationship_description: One content type can be used in multiple bibliographic records.

tables.name: mst_custom_field
tables.description: Defines custom fields for biblio and member tables.

tables.name: mst_frequency
tables.description: Master list of publication frequencies for serials.

relationships.relationship_description: One frequency can be assigned to multiple bibliographic records (serials).

tables.name: mst_gmd
tables.description: Master list of General Material Designations (GMDs).

relationships.relationship_description: One GMD can be used for multiple bibliographic records.
One GMD can be assigned to multiple serial publications.
GMD name is referenced in stock_take_item for reporting.

tables.name: mst_item_status
tables.description: Master list of item statuses (e.g., 'Available', 'Loaned', 'Repair').

relationships.relationship_description: One item status can be assigned to multiple items.

tables.name: mst_label
tables.description: Master list of labels for bibliographic records.

tables.name: mst_language
tables.description: Master list of languages.

relationships.relationship_description: One language can be used in multiple bibliographic records.
Language name is referenced in loan_history for reporting.

tables.name: mst_loan_rules
tables.description: Defines flexible loan rules based on member type, collection type, and GMD.

relationships.relationship_description: Multiple loan transactions can follow one loan rule.

tables.name: mst_location
tables.description: Master list of collection locations within the library.

relationships.relationship_description: One location can store multiple items.
Location name is referenced in loan_history for reporting.
Location is referenced in stock_take_item for inventory.

tables.name: mst_media_type
tables.description: Master list of RDA media types.

relationships.relationship_description: One media type can be used in multiple bibliographic records.

tables.name: mst_member_type
tables.description: Master list of member types (e.g., 'Student', 'Faculty', 'General Public').

relationships.relationship_description: One member type can be assigned to multiple members.
One member type can have multiple associated loan rules.
Member type name is referenced in loan_history for reporting.

tables.name: mst_module
tables.description: Master list of system modules.

relationships.relationship_description: One module can have access rules defined for multiple user groups.

tables.name: mst_place
tables.description: Master list of publication places.

relationships.relationship_description: One place can be the publication place for multiple bibliographic records.

tables.name: mst_publisher
tables.description: Master list of publishers.

relationships.relationship_description: One publisher can publish multiple bibliographic records.

tables.name: mst_relation_term
tables.description: Master list of relationship terms for vocabulary control.

relationships.relationship_description: One relation term can be used in multiple vocabulary control entries.

tables.name: mst_servers
tables.description: Master list of external catalog servers (Z39.50, P2P).

tables.name: mst_supplier
tables.description: Master list of suppliers.

relationships.relationship_description: One supplier can provide multiple items.

tables.name: mst_topic
tables.description: Master list of topics/subjects.

relationships.relationship_description: One topic can be associated with multiple bibliographic records.
One topic can be the main topic in multiple vocabulary control entries.
One topic can be a related topic in multiple vocabulary control entries.
Topic names are referenced in search_biblio for indexing.

tables.name: mst_visitor_room
tables.description: Master list of visitor rooms within the library.

relationships.relationship_description: One visitor room can have multiple visit logs.

tables.name: plugins
tables.description: Manages system plugins.

tables.name: reserve
tables.description: Manages item reservations by members.

relationships.relationship_description: Many reservations can be for one biblio record.
Many reservations can be made by one member.
Many reservations can be for one specific item.

tables.name: search_biblio
tables.description: Index table for advanced bibliographic searching.

relationships.relationship_description: One search_biblio record corresponds to one biblio record.

tables.name: serial
tables.description: Manages serial publications subscriptions.

relationships.relationship_description: Many serial publications can refer to one biblio record (parent title).
Many serial publications can have one GMD.
One serial publication can have multiple kardex records.

tables.name: setting
tables.description: Stores system-wide settings and configurations.

tables.name: stock_take
tables.description: Manages stock take (inventory) processes.

relationships.relationship_description: One stock take process can involve multiple items.

tables.name: stock_take_item
tables.description: Items included in a stock take process.

relationships.relationship_description: Many stock_take_item records belong to one stock take process.
Many stock_take_item records can refer to one item.

tables.name: system_log
tables.description: Logs system activities, user actions, and errors.

tables.name: user
tables.description: Stores user accounts for library staff.

relationships.relationship_description: One user can perform multiple backups.
One user can upload multiple files.
One user can be the last updater for multiple items.
One user can be the last updater for multiple loan transactions.
One user can manage multiple plugins.
One user can generate multiple biblio logs.
One user can read multiple files.

tables.name: user_group
tables.description: Defines user groups for access control.

relationships.relationship_description: One user group can have multiple access rules defined.
One user group can have multiple users.

tables.name: visitor_count
tables.description: Tracks visitor check-in counts.

relationships.relationship_description: Many visit logs can be associated with one member.
Many visit logs can be for one visitor room.

tables.name: vocabolary_control
tables.description: Manages vocabulary control (thesaurus) relationships between topics.

relationships.relationship_description: Many vocabulary control entries can have one main topic.
Many vocabulary control entries can use one relation term.
Many vocabulary control entries can have one related topic.

tables.name: biblio_relation
tables.description: Defines relationships between bibliographic records (e.g., sequels, prequels, translations).

relationships.relationship_description: Many biblio_relation records can refer to one biblio record (as biblio_id).
Many biblio_relation records can refer to one biblio record (as rel_biblio_id).
Many-to-many relationship between biblio records through biblio_relation.

tables.name: cache
tables.description: Stores cached data for performance optimization.

tables.name: biblio_custom
tables.description: Table for storing custom fields data for bibliographic records. One-to-one relationship with biblio.

relationships.relationship_description: One-to-one relationship with biblio.

tables.name: member_custom
tables.description: Table for storing custom fields data for members. One-to-one relationship with member.

relationships.relationship_description: One-to-one relationship with member.

tables.name: comment
tables.description: Stores comments made by members on bibliographic records.

relationships.relationship_description: Many comments can be for one biblio record.
Many comments can be written by one member.

tables.name: files_read
tables.description: Logs file read activities.

relationships.relationship_description: Many files_read records can refer to one file.
Many files_read records can be associated with one member.
Many files_read records can be associated with one user.

tables.name: index_documents
tables.description: Links indexed words to documents (bibliographic records).

relationships.relationship_description: Many index_documents records can refer to one biblio record.
Many index_documents records can refer to one index_words record.

tables.name: index_words
tables.description: Stores indexed words for full-text searching.

relationships.relationship_description: One index_words record can be referenced by multiple index_documents records.

tables.name: biblio_mark
tables.description: Stores bibliographic record bookmarks by members.

relationships.relationship_description: Many biblio_mark records can be associated with one member.
Many biblio_mark records can refer to one biblio record.
